lines.text: Trumpets sound. Enter MARK ANTONY and EROS; a Soldier meeting them

lines.speaker: soldier
lines.text: The gods make this a happy day to Antony!

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Would thou and those thy scars had once prevail'd To make me fight at land!

lines.speaker: soldier
lines.text: Hadst thou done so, The kings that have revolted, and the soldier That has this morning left thee, would have still Follow'd thy heels.

lines.speaker: soldier
lines.text: Who! One ever near thee: call for Enobarbus, He shall not hear thee; or from Caesar's camp Say 'I am none of thine.'

lines.speaker: eros
lines.text: Sir, his chests and treasure He has not with him.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Go, Eros, send his treasure after; do it; Detain no jot, I charge thee: write to him-- I will subscribe--gentle adieus and greetings; Say that I wish he never find more cause To change a master. O, my fortunes have Corrupted honest men! Dispatch.--Enobarbus!
